tourist_spots.name: Charminar
tourist_spots.description: The Charminar is the signature monument of Hyderabad, built in 1591 by Mohammed Quli Qutb Shah. It features four minarets and is a famous historical landmark.

tourist_spots.name: Golconda Fort
tourist_spots.description: One of India's famous forts, originally a mud fort, later rebuilt by the Qutb Shahis. Known for its acoustics, palaces, and unique water supply system.

tourist_spots.name: Taramati Baradari
tourist_spots.description: A heritage monument built by the Seventh Sultan of Golconda, now a cultural venue for music and arts, located near Golconda Fort.

tourist_spots.name: Birla Mandir
tourist_spots.description: A white marble temple of Lord Venkateshwara, offering a panoramic view of the city from Kala Pahad.

tourist_spots.name: Salar Jung Museum
tourist_spots.description: One of the world's largest one-man collections of antiques, featuring Persian carpets, Moghal miniatures, and the famous Veiled Rebecca statue.

tourist_spots.name: Nehru Zoological Park
tourist_spots.description: A 300-acre zoo with over 250 species of animals and birds, known for its Lion Safari Park and Natural History Museum.

tourist_spots.name: Hussainsagar Lake
tourist_spots.description: A historic lake built in 1562, featuring a large monolithic Buddha statue and boating activities.

tourist_spots.name: Shilparamam
tourist_spots.description: A 30-acre arts and crafts village showcasing traditional Indian crafts and hosting annual bazaars.

tourist_spots.name: Chilkur Balaji Temple
tourist_spots.description: A famous pilgrimage site known as the Visa Balaji Temple, located on the outskirts of Hyderabad.

tourist_spots.name: KBR National Park
tourist_spots.description: A large urban park with diverse flora and fauna, including over 100 species of birds and 20 species of reptiles.
